title: How Many Calories in a Shot?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in shot of liquor, including total energy, macros, and variations for different spirits or proofs.
h1: How Many Calories in a Shot?
assumptions: Standard 1.5 oz (44 ml) shot of 80-proof (40% ABV) distilled spirits like vodka, gin, or whiskey; no mixers or additives.
disclaimer: Calories vary by spirit type, proof, brand, and serving size. Pure alcohol contributes all calories; check labels for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard shot of 80-proof liquor contains about 97 calories, primarily from alcohol.

label_note: Values reflect Nutrition Facts style; alcohol calories are not counted in carbs, protein, or fat.

tweaks.label: Shot of flavored liqueur (e.g., with added sugars)

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of vodka?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal for a 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof vodka.

faqs.q: Do shots have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No—pure liquor shots have 0 g carbs, protein, or fat; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in a shot?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more alcohol and calories; 100-proof adds ~24 kcal over 80-proof.

faqs.q: What about calories in a shot of whiskey?
faqs.a: Similar to vodka—around 97 kcal for 80-proof, 1.5 oz serving.
Stick to straight high-proof spirits or zero-calorie mixers to keep it under 100 kcal.
